about.title: About PoP
about.purposeText: This is an educational tool to demonstrate that Bitcoin investing requires sacrifice, discipline, and low time preference. It is NOT a trading tool, price predictor, or profit optimizer.
about.philosophyText: Bitcoin teaches behavior, not profit. Most of the experience is drawdown, lateralization, and discomfort. A small number of days explain most appreciation, and these days are unpredictable.

hero.subtitle: Bitcoin rewards patience, not timing

problem1.title: Panic Selling
problem1.text: Many investors sell during price drops, locking in losses instead of waiting for recovery.

problem2.title: Taking Small Profits
problem2.text: Exiting too early after modest gains prevents participation in long-term exponential growth.

problem3.title: Timing the Market
problem3.text: Trying to predict perfect entry and exit points often leads to missed opportunities.

hero.keyMessage: Bitcoin is not about finding the perfect moment. It's about having the patience to stay invested through volatility.

shortTerm.title: The Short-Term Trap
shortTerm.intro: Looking at daily or monthly price movements creates unnecessary anxiety and leads to poor decisions.
shortTerm.warning: Each card below shows a month's performance. The colors indicate whether there were more positive (green), negative (red), or lateral (white) days. This short-term view doesn't reflect Bitcoin's fundamentals and causes panic selling during drops or premature profit-taking during rises.
shortTerm.conclusion: Day-to-day volatility is noise. What matters is long-term exposure.

longTerm.title: The Long-Term Solution: DCA
longTerm.what: Dollar Cost Averaging (DCA) means buying a fixed amount regularly, regardless of price.
longTerm.why: Instead of trying to time the market (buying low, selling high), DCA focuses on time in the market. What matters is how long you're exposed to the asset, not when you enter or exit.
longTerm.conclusion: Consistency beats timing. Time in the market matters more than timing the market.

details.title: The Real Numbers
details.intro: Here's the month-by-month breakdown. Notice the average monthly gain - it may not look impressive, but it's the true indicator of Bitcoin's growth.
details.keyInsight: The average monthly gain might seem modest, but this is what Bitcoin truly offers.
details.finalMessage: This is the metric that should guide your investment decision - not daily volatility or short-term swings. Bitcoin rewards patience and consistency.
details.noteText: Each row shows a monthly investment. The weighted average monthly gain reflects the true long-term performance of your Bitcoin strategy.
